posts.post_content: Ugn. Every time I see a land like this I gag a little. Even assuming a multicolor deck, your chances of drawing a land of the color you need are just as good as drawing this sad little thing. By the time you can afford to blow two mana on making one mana, you probably have a good variety of lands out anyway, and before that point you're just crippling yourself. You'd need to be running some sort of crazy every color ever deck to make this and all its friends remotely feasible.
posts.html:

You'd need to be running some sort of crazy every color ever deck to make this and all its friends remotely feasible.

Posted By: A3Kitsune (2/20/2010 3:19:15 AM)
Rating:

@AchillesElbow
Colorless general means you cannot use any land that has a colored mana symbol on it. Thus, useful for Eldrazi General or Karn. You are not permitted to use basics. This card's second ability is irrelevant.

All around jank. I play an EDH Kozi, though. I use it. I think I would pick even tarnished citadel over this any other time.

posts.post_content:
Many, many years ago, I found a small box filled with Magic cards (~80). I thought i made it; sadly, about half of those cards were crappy commons, aside from a couple [Soul Link](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Link)s and [Squee's Embrace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Squee's Embrace)s, and the other half were like 10 of these and 20 [Martyrs' Tomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Martyrs' Tomb).   
I'm starting to think that the previous owner should've been really happy to have gotten rid of those turds.
